channel.title: New Animations for Zombies
channel.description:
Probably I'm much too late with my demand / suggestion.
But if there was one thing which I really loved in Half-Life 1 compared to Half-Life 2 was the more creepy appearence of the zombies.
In Half-Life 2 the Zombies just looked clumsy. Headcrabs just appeared oversized and the tottering style of movement in combination with the moaning rather made them looks like some drunk fools walking down the street. They appear so vulnerable that I sometimes even felt sorry for killing them.
On the other hand the Zombies in Half-Life 1 had something more threatening. They didn't appear like some sort human lifeform anymore, but more like something more gross, somehow letting you feel as player that these bodies aren't in control of humans anymore. Their stiff and upright style of walking was just more creepy and they appeared much. Especially when you were trapped on a narrow catwalk and these things kept on walking straight into your direction. While you were firing your Berreta and started to run out of bullets, preparing yourself for close combat with the crowbar.

item.title: New Animations for Zombies
item.dc:creator: Vatz
item.description:
I agree that the zombies were scarier in the first Half Life, but I think the animations should be a moderate mix of the HL and HL2 anims. Much like what they have now.

Read full topic

item.title: New Animations for Zombies
item.dc:creator: Tuskin38
item.description:
I thought the zombie animations in HL1 were superior, excluding the chunky ness.

Read full topic

item.title: New Animations for Zombies
item.dc:creator: Vatz
item.description:
Mr. Someguy:
  1. Learn to spell, and spell out your words. You’re not a 12 year old on AIM.

I agree.

  1. The Zombine is only half-dead. The electronic implants are still trying to operate dispite the host’s brain missing.

I agree.

  1. The Poison and Fast headcrabs are a product of evolution.

I disagree with you on that. They may be natural evolution, but there wouldn’t really be much point in evolving those forms past a few scattered caves or deep-woods ponds where the exact conditions that would require those conditions were met. If the Combine had developed them, however, it would explain why they were not only in the headcrab rockets along with the normal headcrabs in HL2’s Ravenholm–and in such a large supply without a Gonarch present–but also why poison/fast zombies appear in larger quantities in Combine-heavy areas.

Read full topic

item.title: New Animations for Zombies
item.dc:creator: Mr_Someguy
item.description:
Maxey:

If you need new animations for the zombies, then put me on a motion cap suit, give me a bottle of liquor and BAM! you’ll have proper zombie animations in no time.

Wake me up about 3-5 hours before I plan on getting up. I’ll give you zombie animations and incoherent mumbling. Only thing is you’ll have to keep me away from walls as I have a tendency to ‘give up’ on balancing myself and just brush alongside them, which would be hard to animate in-game.

Read full topic

item.title: New Animations for Zombies
item.dc:creator: ffelix8
item.description:
Mr. Someguy:

Well it doesn’t matter. The sounds are already done, and they are [COLOR=‘DarkOrange’]juicy.
https://forums.blackmesasource.com/showthread.php?p=56755post56755
https://forums.blackmesasource.com/showthread.php?p=238681post238681

If you want HL1 Zombie sounds, go to the HL1 or HLS folder, take them from there, put them in the BMS Folder, and rename any that might need it.

I’ll do that if i will not like them. I hope there will be less content from HL2. I am glad that sound are remade and aminations too as i see on screenshots… I don’t want to hear human voice calling for help.

Read full topic

item.title: New Animations for Zombies
item.dc:creator: Mr_Someguy
item.description:
ffelix8:

We can ignore all that was made in HL2 and make in HL1 style cuz this is HL1 remake.

Well it doesn’t matter. The sounds are already done, and they are [COLOR=‘DarkOrange’]juicy.
https://forums.blackmesasource.com/showthread.php?p=56755post56755
https://forums.blackmesasource.com/showthread.php?p=238681post238681

If you want HL1 Zombie sounds, go to the HL1 or HLS folder, take them from there, put them in the BMS Folder, and rename any that might need it.

item.title: New Animations for Zombies
item.dc:creator: mechaelite
item.description:
ffelix8:

How the f would anyone survive with big mouth with sharp teeth in your body??? Host is absolutely dead and headcrab zombie should only be a headcrab with human body. You all want to see l4d style zombies- screaming and running. HL1 zombie is a headcrab controlled human body, not human.

that’s why I preffear the fast zombie in hl2, they seem to be a complete dead body controlled only by the headcrab, nothing about feeling pain and all that crap that the normal one have, just a headcrab with a body. (you will surelly find something I didn’t write well 'cause I am tired and I want to sleep right now and someone will come with a coment saying fix’d or something like that.)

Mr. Someguy:

Because the Headcrab is acting like Life Support, it’s keeping the brain alive even though the rest of the vital organs have mostly shut down. Normal Headcrab Zombies are still aware of what’s going on, but all they can do is yell and scream in pain and terror as they have no control over their limbs.

That is 1 of the things I don’t like, hear reversed sounds of pain in the host, what I liked of hl1 is that they didn’t do that and they had their own alien sounds not human reversed ones like GET IT OFF ME, GET IT OFF! <-a reversed sound of a normal zombie pain.

Read full topic

item.title: New Animations for Zombies
item.dc:creator: ffelix8
item.description:
Grey Acumen:

Valve already did that. It’s called HL: Source.

It’s a shame none of the archives were around from when Black Mesa was back in it’s 1st - 3rd year of development. It would be great to be able to go back and find the first person who ever said that, and actually quote them instead of just constantly repeating this same phrase.

They just ported all to source engine. Thanks to BMS well see a real remake of HL1. Anyways well see everything after release. There are so many opinions. Everyone wants something different. If something will be really annoying me, I’ll change that.

Read full topic
